comment: He's not designer guy, he has no idea what he's talking about. He thinks he smart jut by reading from power point.

Took for strength of materials lab. Worst lab experience I've had at this school by far. Students do not perform the lab, we just sit and watch him do it and explain things in a long winded and convoluted manner. He then provides data to use for the report which is often unclear and missing information.

He was good but not very accessible outside of class because he works full-time. He's very patient and nice. He sometimes figured out problems with projects as we were doing them so we sometimes got busy work. There is an assignment every day, a midterm, and a final. He takes attendance but not sure if it was part of the final grade.

He definitely cares about his students and helps anyone in a heartbeat. He's not the best teacher but knows how to work the programs pretty well. He teaches way more programs than just AutoCAD and Civil3D which I actually liked more. It is an easy A if you just go to class, make your project look like his example, and get him to check it.

He is a funny guy and likes to have a good time. Unfortunately he does not let the class do anything in the lab, while other professors do. Half of the labs he just gave us the results and told us to do the report. He takes forever to grade lab reports and says he will never give anyone full credit because no one is perfect. Decent professor.

Absolutely ridiculous grading criteria. Does not believe in much partial credit, and will give you homework problems the EXACT same as the examples, but then somehow come up with different answers. Is not clear on what he wants on his feedback, generally just marks it as wrong. Hides example solutions from his powerpoints also which is stupid.

I did not read the reviews on Professor Emmanuel until the semester was about halfway finished. It was a good thing that I didn't because I would likely have not taken his course given the extensive amount of negative feedback. Do not listen to these people- I highly recommend taking him.

This is the strength of materials Lab. He was a very interesting professor. The labs were very cool and he did a good job explaining the materials and the process. The lab has a group report for each one. He expects a well written and though report, but give you a template. He also lets you correct all of the labs. It is an easy A if you work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Pretty good teacher, brought in a lot of outside transportation engineers which was pretty insightful. Would have been more interesting if I was actually majoring in transportation. Upsides: Nice Guy, easy quizzes, easy tests. Downsides: Homework heavy, very tough grader, insane group project at the end of the semester
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He was a new man for highway. He graded much more lenient, and was fair on the projects. Overall, hes a real world guy trying to work with the school, and it doesn't always translate the best, but taking him you are better for it. The job is what matters, not the school. if you want to learn the job, take him.

Even if I didn't know this professor, I could see that some of these students are very bitter. So read wisely. Emmanuel was a great professor with me. As long as I treated him with respect, emailed him in advance ect, he did the same with me. He knows his stuff. The only fault may be his grading criteria. These other comments are not 100% honest.

The professor is not respected as a professor or a man and the reason is that he does not respect his students, he is a liar, and will out right laugh at you in front of the entire class. If you have the unfortunate luck to have to take him, get him to sign anything he says so you have proof of his lies.

Worst professor I have ever had. He lies about extra credit on exams, if he says there will be 25 bonus points he will change his mind after the exam and the bonus will be graded for credit. He is sarcastic and will laugh in your face if you try to ask him a serious question and just has a bad attitude towards students. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF
This professor is awful. You will not learn only memorize. He teaches his class so that if you memorize the problems you pass.

Emmanuel is a Greeaat Professor!! Yes he does give lots of homework and a quiz every week but he basically gives you the EXACT answers for the quiz the lecture before! And his Test are the Quizzes!!  All you have to do is show up to class and TAKE NOTES! He's extremely helpful, I'm a little confused on how anyone couldn't do well in his class.

Grading criteria is unclear, a hw assignment with four questions worth 100 point could have 1 question worth 50, 2 worth 20, and 1 worth 10 and you will not know this until you get the graded assignment back. After the fact he will change his mind on a BONUS question, and if you did not answer/got it wrong you get points off. His mistakesyour prob

Worst professor I have ever taken. Quizzes EVERY week. His idea of a 15 minute quiz is 10-30 questions, comprised of some true/false but mostly calculation based and if you don't show your work he docks you. Memorization is the key to his class, you do not have time to actually work out the problems on quizzes and exams so memorize everything.

Emmanuel teaches his class so that if you memorize what he goes over you will pass. His class is useless for this reason. The class examples are the HW, which are the quizzes, which are the exams. You see the same problems (and number) for each. He does not give enough time to work things out so if you don't memorize you can't finish in time.
Go to class.  Copy example problems that are exactly same as homework problems. Pay attention before quizzes because he goes over answers right before.... pass with flying colors

Don't take this professor if you can help it. Long quizzes EVERY WEEK and only allows 15 minutes when it really takes 20+ to finish. Grades harshly and will change his mind about a bonus question being bonus AFTER the quiz.  Gives homework AT LEAST once a week, sometimes having a homework assignment due each class.
Rate My Professor will not allow me to say what needs to be said about this professor, as a professor or as a man... SERIOUSLY AVOID AT ALL COST!!!

CAUTION! He will tell you at the beginning of the semester that the labs will never exceed an hr and a half... that will change. He will decide that he wants to take 3 hours to discuss something you could read at home. He holds onto your labs for 5 weeks and then gives them back and tells you to fix them, after fixing you only get a few points back
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Stay away! Is hilariously picky about everything students turn in (will deduct for things like using a pen, not putting units inside equations, writing night instead of night time), yet does not hold himself to the same standards (bonus ?, opps he didnt mean that, POINTS OFF) Hw and Quiz every week. He is also very condescending.

He is inspirational. inspirational to get rid of government road design. Sit in traffic and Atlanta and see why the roads are messed up? its this guys fault. but don't give him the benefit of the doubt, because he will not give partial credit. AT ALL. midterm evaluations all asked for partial credit and he said no way he can't. grading is unclear
All in all one of the worst professors I've ever had. Does not grade fairly, and gives you a quiz that takes 30 minutes to do but only gives you 15. Quiz every week and hw every week.

Not a good professor. Grades harshly and when asked a question cannot give a straight answer because he does not know what he is talking about. No partial credit and quizzes every week. Also takes forever to grade so it is halfway through the semester before you know what you did wrong with the labs. Would not take if you have a choice.

Formulers is how he says it. No partial credit. Entertaining guy, but he is the epitome of GDOT and why Atlanta traffic is 8th worst in the world. Get one answer wrong on part of a problem, and it is all wrong.
